title: React2Shell: Inside the Maximum-Severity RCE Vulnerability Exposing React and Next.js
excerpt: React2Shell (CVE-2025-55182) is a critical CVSS 10.0 vulnerability in React Server Components that allows unauthenticated attackers to achieve remote code execution via unsafe deserialization in the Flight protocol. Affecting default configurations of Next.js and other frameworks, this "zero-config" exploit is currently seeing active weaponization by nation-state threat actors. Learn how the vulnerability works, why WAFs offer incomplete protection, and the urgent patching steps required to secure your infrastructure

content.text:
Modern web development is built on trust — trust in frameworks, 
abstractions, and open-source ecosystems. In December 2025, that trust 
was severely tested when 
React2Shell (CVE-2025-55182)
 surfaced as one of the most dangerous web vulnerabilities ever recorded.
This article goes beyond surface-level coverage to extract 
five hard security lessons every React, Next.js, and cloud-native developer must internalize.
1.0 Introduction — The Day the Web Stood Still
React powers over 
40% of the top 10,000 websites
, forming the backbone of enterprise dashboards, SaaS platforms, fintech products, and global e-commerce.
On 
December 3, 2025
, the disclosure of 
CVE-2025-55182
 — widely known as 
React2Shell
 — sent shockwaves through the ecosystem.
CVSS Score:
 10.0 (Critical)  
Exploit Type:
 Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
Attack Surface:
 React Server Components (RSC)
Impact:
 Full server compromise at scale
A frightening reality emerged: 
a default framework setup had become a global attack surface.
2.0 Takeaway #1 — Your Default App Was a Ticking Time Bomb

The most disturbing revelation wasn’t 
how
 React2Shell worked — it was 
how little developers had to do to become vulnerable
.
With React2Shell, developers didn’t need to make a single mistake.
Security teams at Wiz and JFrog verified that a default production app created using:
npx create-next-app@latest
…was exploitable 
with zero custom code changes
.
Why This Was So Dangerous
The flaw lived deep inside 
React’s core deserialization logic
It bypassed authentication, authorization, and validation
It turned normal production builds into 
pre-compromised servers
A Fireship breakdown put it bluntly:
“Log4Shell nearly crippled the global economy in 2021. In 2025, its spiritual successor arrived: React2Shell.”
3.0 Takeaway #2 — Weaponization Now Happens in Minutes


React2Shell exposed a harsh new security reality:
There is no longer a patch grace period.
Within 
hours of disclosure
, active exploitation was observed. Amazon’s threat intelligence linked early adoption to:
Earth Lamia
  
Jackpot Panda
What This Means
Automated exploit pipelines react 
faster than human patch cycles
Public disclosure instantly becomes attacker telemetry
Blue-team response time is effectively 
near zero
The exploit economy now operates in 
real time
.
4.0 Takeaway #3 — Attackers Weren’t After Your Website; They Wanted Your Cloud


React2Shell wasn’t used for petty intrusion — it became a 
launchpad for cloud takeover
.
Once attackers got RCE, they escalated rapidly:
Credential Harvesting
Environment variables  
Filesystem secrets  
Cloud metadata services  
Targeting AWS IAM keys, Docker creds, Git tokens, SSH keys
Cryptomining
Deployment of 
XMRig
Large-scale compute hijacking
Persistent Backdoors
Advanced actors installed:
Sliver C2
EtherRAT
EtherRAT used 
Ethereum smart contracts for C2 lookup
, making takedowns extremely difficult.
Key point:
 A frontend framework bug became a 
cloud-wide breach vector
.
5.0 Takeaway #4 — Next.js Was the Epicenter, but the Real Risk Was the Supply Chain


Although Next.js took the spotlight, the root flaw lived inside 
React Server Components (RSC)
.


Vulnerable Packages
react-server-dom-webpack
react-server-dom-parcel
react-server-dom-turbopack
Why Next.js Was Hit Hard
Any app using the 
App Router
 was exploitable by simply sending:
next-action: true
No Server Actions required. No special code.
A classic 
secure-by-assumption failure
.
The Supply Chain Blind Spot
Next.js 
vendors React internally
, which caused:
React updates to 
not propagate automatically
A second CVE (
CVE-2025-66478
) to be issued
Many scanners to 
miss the vulnerability entirely
Additional Affected Frameworks
Waku  
Expo  
RedwoodSDK  
React Router (RSC mode)  
Vite RSC plugin  
Parcel RSC plugin
One upstream flaw silently compromised dozens of downstream tools.
6.0 Takeaway #5 — Fake PoCs Created Dangerous Noise
Within hours of disclosure, GitHub and social media were flooded with 
fake or broken PoCs
.
The original researcher, Lachlan Davidson, warned:


“Many circulating PoCs are incorrect and may lead to false negatives when testing for vulnerability.”
Common incorrect assumptions included:
Believing 
child_process.exec
 must be exposed  
Misunderstanding RSC Flight protocol behavior  
Incorrect deserialization vectors
Itai Goldman
 summarized the risk:
“Broken PoCs give defenders false confidence. The exploit is real — but the noise makes teams underestimate its reach.”
Lesson:
 Never rely on random PoCs for validation.
7.0 Final Analysis — What React2Shell Taught the Industry
React2Shell was more than a vulnerability. It was a 
stress test of modern web security
.
It exposed:
The fragility of abstraction-heavy frameworks  
The explosion of attack surface from RSC  
The danger of hidden supply chain dependencies  
The collapse of traditional patch timelines
Strategic Lessons for Teams
Treat default configs as hostile  
Assume framework internals can fail  
Include supply chain risk in threat models  
Implement runtime intrusion detection  
Lock down outbound network access  
Rotate all environment-level secrets

8.0 Closing Thoughts
React and Next.js remain extraordinary engineering tools — but React2Shell proved that 
abstraction amplifies both productivity and blast radius
.
The core takeaway:
Security must extend into the frameworks we depend on. Trust must be verifiable, not assumed.
Call to Action
If you're running:
React Server Components  
Next.js App Router  
Expo, Redwood, or Vite RSC
You should immediately:
Audit bundled React versions  
Confirm patch levels  
Restrict outbound network access  
Rotate environment and metadata-exposed secrets

title: The Epstein Files Explained: Facts, Redactions, and the Fight for Transparency
excerpt: A clear breakdown of the Epstein Files—verified facts, redactions, leaked Volume 8 claims, and why transparency still matters years after Epstein’s death.

content.text:
Years after his death, the shadow of 
Jeffrey Epstein
 continues to loom over America’s political, legal, and financial elite—not because of what is definitively known, but because of what remains deliberately obscured. Epstein was a convicted child sex offender and financier who cultivated a dense network of powerful individuals across politics, business, academia, and entertainment.
His 2019 death in a Manhattan jail cell, officially ruled a suicide, transformed an already disturbing criminal case into a prolonged crisis of public trust—one defined by sealed records, redacted documents, and unanswered questions.
The phrase 
“Epstein files”
 has become shorthand for a sprawling body of evidence whose partial release has only intensified suspicion. At its core, this controversy reflects a clash between the public’s demand for transparency and institutional systems that appear resistant to full disclosure.
What Are the “Epstein Files”?
The “Epstein files” are not a single document or list. The term refers to the entire collection of records generated through multiple investigations into Epstein and his associates. These materials—stored within the FBI’s Sentinel case management system—span decades and include documents, images, audio, and digital data totaling hundreds of gigabytes.
2003345031877525708
Defining the Documents
The evidence compiled across Epstein-related cases includes:
Contact books
, including Epstein’s “little black book”
Flight logs
 from his private aircraft
Court records
, such as depositions, indictments, warrants, and grand jury material
Photographs and videos
 seized from properties in New York, Florida, and the U.S. Virgin Islands
Financial records
 detailing payments, trusts, and asset movements
Internal communications
 between Epstein, associates, intermediaries, and federal agencies
Individually, these records are fragments. Together, they outline both the mechanics of Epstein’s trafficking operation and the scale of his social reach.
2003468957333008473
The Myth of the “Client List”
2003466191734505540
One of the most persistent claims surrounding the case is the existence of a secret “Epstein client list.” In a July 2025 memo, the 
U.S. Department of Justice
 stated that no such list exists and that investigators found no credible evidence Epstein blackmailed prominent individuals.
That assertion was met with immediate skepticism. Multiple court filings reference unnamed 
co-conspirators
, while redactions obscure identities that could otherwise clarify the scope of criminal involvement. The contradiction between internal references and public statements continues to fuel distrust.
The Push for Transparency: The Epstein Files Transparency Act
Mounting public pressure culminated in the passage of the Epstein Files Transparency Act, signed into law by 
Donald Trump
 on November 19, 2025. The law required all Epstein-related government files to be released in a searchable public format within 30 days.
When the December 19 deadline arrived, the DOJ released only a partial dataset. Many pages were heavily redacted—some entirely blacked out. Lawmakers who authored the bill publicly accused the department of violating federal law, reinforcing concerns that transparency was being selectively applied.
What Has Been Officially Confirmed?
Despite speculation and misinformation, a core set of facts is firmly established through court records and sworn testimony:
2005
: Palm Beach police opened an investigation following allegations involving a 14-year-old girl
2008
: Epstein secured a controversial non-prosecution agreement and served 13 months on a state charge with work release
2019
: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan charged him with sex trafficking involving dozens of victims
August 10, 2019
: Epstein was found dead in his jail cell; his death was ruled a suicide
His associate 
Ghislaine Maxwell
 was later convicted and sentenced to 20 years in prison
Investigators recovered an expired Austrian passport under a false name from Epstein’s residence
Snapshot of Publicly Verified Information
The table below consolidates 
publicly verified, on-record facts
 drawn from court filings, DOJ releases, and investigative records. It reflects documentation—not allegation.
Category
Description
Flight Logs
Documented travel between Florida, New York, Washington D.C., and the U.S. Virgin Islands
Court Case
United States of America v. Jeffrey Epstein (2008)
 — plea agreement and non-prosecution deal
Court Case
United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell
 — conviction for sex trafficking
DOJ Statement
July 2025 memo denying existence of a verified “client list”
Evidence
Seizure of fraudulent passport and financial records
Death Record
Medical examiner ruling Epstein’s death a suicide
High-Profile Names: Separating Fact From Allegation
2003631852246966372
The most controversial aspect of the Epstein files is the appearance of powerful names. Legal rigor is essential.
A Necessary Caveat
As emphasized by the Associated Press, 
the presence of a name in Epstein-related files does not imply criminal wrongdoing
. Association—through travel, contact lists, or photographs—is not evidence of participation in criminal acts.
Who Is Mentioned, and How?
Donald Trump
 — Documented social interactions and flight references; later stated he banned Epstein from Mar-a-Lago in 2007
Bill Clinton
 — Appears in court files and photographs; allegations clarified in sworn testimony as second-hand claims
Prince Andrew
 — Named in civil allegations by Virginia Giuffre; denied wrongdoing and later settled the lawsuit
Bill Gates
 — Acknowledged meetings with Epstein after 2008 and publicly described them as a serious mistake
Context—not proximity—determines meaning.
Volume 8 Leak: Investigative Claims and Redaction Disputes
Editorial note
: The following section summarizes claims from independent investigative analysis of alleged leaked materials. These assertions have not been adjudicated in court and should be read as reported interpretations, not established fact.
What Is “Volume 8”?
“Volume 8” refers to a set of Epstein-related documents that were 
not part of official DOJ releases
 but reportedly became accessible due to an apparent accidental exposure via direct URLs. Independent investigators, including collaborators such as Coffeezilla, analyzed these files, arguing they contain information that 
challenges official narratives
 about the scope of the investigation.
Key Claims From the Analysis
References to 10 Co-Conspirators

Internal FBI emails from as early as 
2019
 reportedly reference 
10 co-conspirators
, contradicting public framing that limited culpability to Epstein and Maxwell. These references allegedly appear within the FBI’s violent crimes and human trafficking units.
Redaction Controversy

Analysts argue that names of alleged co-conspirators—not victims—are being redacted in ways inconsistent with the Epstein Files Transparency Act, which prohibits redactions for embarrassment or reputational harm.
Investigative Stall

Emails cited in the analysis suggest early investigative momentum, including subpoenas and warrants, followed by a noticeable halt without public explanation.
Timeline Referenced in Volume 8 Claims
Timeframe
Claimed Development
2019
FBI emails reference 10 co-conspirators
2020
U.S. Attorney confirms conspiracy charges were under consideration
2024
Volume 8 documents reportedly accessed
Post-Leak
Renewed public scrutiny and debate
Figures Referenced in Volume 8 Discussions
Name
Context
Status
Jeffrey Epstein
Central subject
Deceased
Ghislaine Maxwell
Convicted associate
Serving sentence
Gene Luke Brunell
Alleged co-conspirator
Deceased
Les Wexner
Mentioned as investigative target
No charges
Donald Trump
Travel and commentary references
No charges
Bill Clinton
Mentioned in documents
No charges
Misinformation, Redactions, and Unanswered Questions

The Redaction Problem
The Transparency Act bars redactions based on embarrassment or political sensitivity. Yet documents continue to obscure alleged co-conspirators’ identities, creating a credibility gap between official statements and documentary practice.
Fabrications and False Documents
Information gaps have enabled hoaxes, including a fabricated letter allegedly written by Epstein to Larry Nassar. Federal authorities later confirmed it was fake—highlighting the risks of speculation in the absence of full disclosure.
The Questions That Remain
If no additional individuals are chargeable, 
why are co-conspirators referenced and redacted?
Why was the legally mandated release incomplete?
Why were close associates—now controlling Epstein’s estate—not fully scrutinized?
The Enduring Pursuit of Justice
The Epstein saga is ultimately not about lists or leaks—it is about accountability. The tension between survivors seeking justice and institutions resistant to transparency remains unresolved.
When a document related to her case was released, survivor 
Annie Farmer
 said she felt both vindicated and heartbroken for victims whose cases were never fully pursued. Her words capture the real stakes of the Epstein files: not scandal, but justice long deferred.

title: Why DRAM Prices Are Rising: How AI Demand Is Squeezing Consumer Memory
excerpt: For years, memory upgrades kept getting cheaper. That trend has quietly reversed. As AI data centers absorb an unprecedented share of global DRAM and high-bandwidth memory supply, consumer PCs, laptops, and smartphones are being pushed down the priority list. This analysis explains why memory prices are rising—and why relief is unlikely before 2026.

content.text:
The End of Cheap Memory
For decades, personal computing followed a reassuring pattern: faster hardware at lower prices. Memory was a cornerstone of that trend, with DRAM costs steadily falling as manufacturing scaled and competition intensified. That pattern has now broken.
Anyone pricing a new PC, laptop, or smartphone has likely noticed that memory upgrades no longer feel routine or inexpensive. The shift is not cyclical or temporary. It reflects a structural change in how the global memory industry allocates supply—driven by the rapid expansion of artificial intelligence infrastructure.
The Great AI Memory Binge
Modern AI systems—especially large language models used for generative tasks—are extraordinarily memory-hungry. They consume vast amounts of memory during both 
training
, when models are built on massive datasets, and 
inference
, when those models respond to real-time queries. Both activities run primarily in hyperscale data centers.
The scale difference is stark. A consumer PC might use tens of gigabytes of memory. An AI server uses orders of magnitude more, and it needs that memory to be extremely fast. This has effectively split the memory market into two distinct tiers:
Consumer DRAM (DDR4/DDR5)

Standard memory modules used in desktops, laptops, and gaming systems. Optimized for cost and broad compatibility.
High-Bandwidth Memory (HBM)

A specialized, stacked memory design placed close to GPUs and accelerators. It delivers dramatically higher throughput and is essential for modern AI workloads.
HBM commands significantly higher margins than consumer DRAM. As AI demand accelerates, that margin gap has become the single most important factor shaping manufacturer priorities.
How AI Demand Squeezes the Consumer Market

Major memory producers manufacture both HBM and consumer DRAM on shared fabrication resources. Faced with surging demand from AI and cloud providers, they are reallocating capacity toward the most profitable products.
This is not a collapse in total output. It is a deliberate shift in mix. Capacity that once fed mainstream DDR4, DDR5, and mobile LPDDR is being redirected—or retired—to support advanced memory stacks for AI accelerators.
Two policies highlight this change:
Allocation-only supply for HBM
, where volumes are pre-sold to large customers and never reach the open market.
Tighter terms for consumer DRAM
, including bundling requirements and constrained order windows.
For consumers, the result is a quieter but persistent shortage: products still exist, but in less flexible quantities and at higher prices.
Why Supply Cannot Ramp Quickly


Semiconductor manufacturing is inherently slow to adjust. A new fabrication plant requires tens of billions of dollars and multiple years to reach volume production. Even incremental capacity expansions carry long lead times.
More importantly, memory makers remain deeply cautious. The industry has endured repeated boom-and-bust cycles over the past decade, where aggressive expansion led to oversupply and severe price collapses. That experience has shaped today’s conservative posture.
Rather than flood the market with new capacity, manufacturers are choosing discipline—prioritizing high-margin segments and avoiding investments that could become stranded if demand shifts.
The Shadow of an AI Bubble
That discipline is reinforced by uncertainty around the longevity of today’s AI spending surge. While demand is real and growing, no manufacturer wants to be left holding excess commodity DRAM capacity if enterprise AI investment slows.
The risk is asymmetric. Overbuilding would expose suppliers to steep losses. Underbuilding merely keeps prices elevated. From a business perspective, caution wins—and consumer supply remains constrained.
What This Means for Component Availability
The effects are already visible in procurement timelines. Lead times that once defined a healthy, competitive market have stretched significantly:
DDR5:
 20–28 weeks
DDR4:
 26–34 weeks
LPDDR4X (mobile):
 24–30 weeks
Automotive and industrial DRAM:
 30–42 weeks
Longer lead times translate directly into higher costs for system builders. Those costs ultimately surface in retail prices for PCs, laptops, and smartphones.
Can New Entrants Provide Relief?
New memory producers, particularly in China, are working to enter the DRAM market. However, the barriers are formidable. Advanced HBM and high-density DRAM require deep process expertise, specialized equipment, and years of yield optimization.
Established suppliers retain a substantial technological lead at the cutting edge. Any meaningful increase in global supply from new entrants is unlikely to materialize in the near term.


Outlook Through 2026
Market indicators suggest the pressure will persist. Industry projections point to sustained growth in overall DRAM demand through the end of the decade, driven largely by AI infrastructure investment, according to Fortune Business Insights.
A further stabilizing factor is the rise of 
sovereign AI
 initiatives. Governments increasingly view domestic AI capability as strategic infrastructure, creating a steady baseline demand for high-performance memory that is less sensitive to economic cycles.
At the same time, the next generation of AI systems—expected later in 2026—will require even more advanced memory technologies, such as HBM4. That roadmap reinforces manufacturers’ focus on the high end of the market.
Memory Pricing Becomes Structural
Higher memory prices are not the result of a temporary shortage or a passing supply-chain disruption. They reflect a durable reordering of priorities within the semiconductor industry.
AI infrastructure now sets the pace for memory investment, capacity planning, and product mix. Consumer devices are no longer the primary driver. As long as AI remains the dominant growth engine, elevated memory costs will remain a defining feature of the market rather than an anomaly.

New memory producers, particularly in China, are working to enter the DRAM market. However, the barriers are formidable. Advanced HBM and high-density DRAM require deep process expertise, specialized equipment, and years of yield optimization.
Established suppliers retain a substantial technological lead at the cutting edge. Any meaningful increase in global supply from new entrants is unlikely to materialize in the near term.

Market indicators suggest the pressure will persist. Industry projections point to sustained growth in overall DRAM demand through the end of the decade, driven largely by AI infrastructure investment, according to Fortune Business Insights.
A further stabilizing factor is the rise of
initiatives. Governments increasingly view domestic AI capability as strategic infrastructure, creating a steady baseline demand for high-performance memory that is less sensitive to economic cycles.

At the same time, the next generation of AI systems—expected later in 2026—will require even more advanced memory technologies, such as HBM4. That roadmap reinforces manufacturers’ focus on the high end of the market.
Higher memory prices are not the result of a temporary shortage or a passing supply-chain disruption. They reflect a durable reordering of priorities within the semiconductor industry.

AI infrastructure now sets the pace for memory investment, capacity planning, and product mix. Consumer devices are no longer the primary driver. As long as AI remains the dominant growth engine, elevated memory costs will remain a defining feature of the market rather than an anomaly.

title: BGMI 1.9 holi update free rewards, all download links, storage required, and more
excerpt: After the successful BGMI 1.8 update, which the players welcomed and enjoyed for the last few months, it is time for the 1.9 version. It is all set..

content.text:
After the successful 
BGMI
 1.8 update, which the players welcomed and enjoyed for the last few months, it is time for the 1.9 version. It is all set to go live today and provides a wide array of exciting features like mode, playground update, revision of Sosnovka Bridge in Erangel and more.
The update has begun rolling out to users and should be available to everyone by the day. It will be fascinating to observe how the players react to these new features and improvements.
BGMI 1.9 update
Reward


The developers are offering the Wild Ambition set (7 days coupon) as an incentive to encourage gamers to update to the latest versions.


Once the update is made available to players, they will be able to download and install the most recent version directly from the Google Play Store and the Apple App Store. On top of this, users on the Android platform have the option to get the latest version through the APK, but utilizing a file from third-party sources is not advisable.
Apple App Store – Click 
here

Google Play Store – Click 
here

Storage requirements
The 
PUBG Mobile
 1.9 update requires around 749 MB of Android devices and 1.88 GB of storage on iOS devices. The BGMI update is expected to be in a similar range to its global counterpart.
Update schedule


Players will be notified if there is a delay in the distribution of the update.

title: React + Next.js: A Beginner-Friendly Guide to Building Awesome Web Apps
excerpt: Learn how to combine the power of React and Next.js to build fast, modern web apps. This beginner-friendly guide walks you through the basics with easy-to-understand code examples.

content.text:
React and Next.js have become one of the most popular combinations in modern web development—and for good reason. Together, they make it easier to build fast, scalable, and SEO-friendly web applications without sacrificing developer experience.
This guide is written for beginners who want a clear, practical understanding of 
what React and Next.js do
, 
why they work so well together
, and 
how to start using them effectively
.
What Are React and Next.js?
React: The UI Foundation
React is a JavaScript library focused on building 
component-based user interfaces
. Instead of managing HTML manually, you break your UI into reusable components that react to changes in data.
Key strengths of React include:
Declarative UI updates
Reusable, composable components
A massive ecosystem and community
Next.js: Production-Ready React
Next.js is a framework built on top of React that solves many real-world problems you face when shipping an application.
It adds:
Built-in routing
Server-side rendering (SSR)
Static site generation (SSG)
Image optimization
Performance optimizations by default
In short, 
React handles the UI
, while 
Next.js handles everything around it
.
Why Use React and Next.js Together?
Using React alone is great for UI logic, but building a complete application often requires extra tooling. Next.js fills those gaps.
Key Advantages
Component-Based Architecture

Both rely on reusable components, keeping your codebase clean and maintainable.
Performance by Default

Automatic code splitting and rendering strategies reduce load times.
SEO-Friendly Rendering

Pages can be rendered on the server, making content visible to search engines.
Simple, File-Based Routing

No need for external routing libraries.
Understanding Pages and Routing in Next.js
Next.js uses a 
file-based routing system
.
Any file inside the 
pages/
 directory automatically becomes a route.
Examples
pages/index.js
 → 
/
pages/about.js
 → 
/about
pages/blog/[id].js
 → 
/blog/123
Dynamic routes make it easy to build blogs, product pages, or user profiles without complex configuration.
Data Fetching in Next.js
One of Next.js’s biggest strengths is how it handles data fetching.
Server-Side Rendering (SSR)
With server-side rendering, data is fetched on each request before the page is sent to the browser. This is useful for:
User-specific data
Frequently changing content
SEO-critical pages
getServerSideProps
 allows you to fetch data securely on the server and pass it to your page as props.
Client-Side Fetching
Not all data needs to be loaded upfront.
For non-critical or user-triggered data, you can fetch data inside React components using:
useEffect
Libraries like SWR or React Query
This approach keeps initial page loads fast.
Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR)
ISR combines the benefits of static pages and dynamic updates.
Pages are generated at build time
They are automatically revalidated at set intervals
This is ideal for blogs, documentation, and marketing pages that need fresh data without rebuilding the entire site.
Performance: Automatic Code Splitting
Next.js automatically splits your JavaScript into smaller bundles.
This means:
Users download only what they need
Faster initial page loads
Better performance on slow networks
You get these optimizations without manual configuration.
Advanced Routing and Layout Patterns
Dynamic and Catch-All Routes
[id].js
 → Matches a single segment
Example: 
/product/123
[...slug].js
 → Matches multiple segments
Example: 
/blog/2024/05/my-post
These patterns are essential for scalable content-driven sites.
State Management Options
As your app grows, managing shared state becomes important.
Popular choices include:
Context API
 – Built into React, great for small to medium apps
Redux
 – Powerful, predictable global state management
Zustand
 – Lightweight and flexible, with minimal boilerplate
Choose based on complexity, not popularity.
Image Optimization with Next.js
Next.js provides the 
<Image />
 component, which automatically:
Serves responsive image sizes
Optimizes formats (like WebP)
Lazy-loads images by default
This improves performance and Core Web Vitals with almost no effort.
Error Handling in Next.js
Next.js includes built-in support for handling errors gracefully.
error.js
 – Custom error UI for route segments
_error.js
 (legacy) – Application-wide error handling
This ensures users see meaningful feedback instead of broken pages.
Example Use Case: A Blog with Dynamic Routes and ISR
A common real-world pattern is:
Dynamic routes for posts (
/blog/[slug]
)
Static generation for performance
ISR to keep content fresh without full rebuilds
This architecture scales well and is widely used in production.
Final Perspective
React and Next.js together offer a balanced approach to modern web development:
React simplifies UI logic
Next.js handles performance, SEO, and scalability
For beginners, this combination provides a gentle learning curve while still being powerful enough for large, real-world applications. As you grow, the same tools continue to scale with you—without forcing a rewrite.
If you're serious about building modern web apps, 
React + Next.js is a solid place to start—and to stay
.

title: MongoBleed Explained: CVE-2025-14847, Memory Leaks, and the Real Risk of Exposed MongoDB Databases
excerpt: MongoBleed (CVE-2025-14847) is a high-severity MongoDB memory leak vulnerability actively exploited in the wild, allowing unauthenticated attackers to extract credentials, API keys, and sensitive data directly from server memory. This deep technical analysis breaks down how the exploit works, why internet-exposed MongoDB instances are especially vulnerable, how to detect real attacks, and what teams must do—immediately and long-term—to secure their databases against both modern CVEs and decade-old misconfiguration risks.

content.text:
MongoBleed: Deconstructing the CVE and the Enduring Threat of Exposed Databases
The recent emergence of 
MongoBleed
, formally tracked as 
CVE-2025-14847
, has put database administrators and security teams on high alert. Disclosed in late 2025, this 
high-severity memory leak vulnerability
 presents an immediate and tangible risk. In practical terms, the flaw allows an 
unauthenticated attacker
 to send a specially crafted message to a vulnerable MongoDB server, causing it to leak fragments of process memory. Those fragments may include 
database credentials, API keys, session tokens, or personally identifiable information (PII)
.
At the same time, the name “MongoBleed” evokes a much older and far more persistent problem. For over a decade, the most damaging MongoDB breaches have not come from sophisticated vulnerabilities, but from 
basic misconfigurations
that leave databases openly exposed to the public internet.
This article serves a dual purpose:
A 
technical deconstruction of CVE-2025-14847
 for teams facing an active exploit
A grounded examination of the 
enduring security failures
 that continue to make MongoDB deployments high-value targets
The Real MongoBleed: Understanding CVE-2025-14847
2005335277020274888
MongoBleed refers specifically to 
CVE-2025-14847
, a 
software defect
, not a configuration mistake. The vulnerability is an 
information disclosure flaw
 in MongoDB’s 
zlib-based network compression handling
.
Researchers quickly noted its similarity to Heartbleed-style bugs: both classes of flaws allow attackers to 
extract sensitive data directly from server memory
, bypassing traditional access controls and query paths. If you’ve followed modern exploit chains in application frameworks and runtimes, this pattern may feel familiar—memory disclosure vulnerabilities often act as force multipliers for follow-on attacks, similar to what we’ve seen in recent RCE and logic flaws such as 
React2Shell (CVE-2025-55182) RCE analysis
.
Key characteristics:
CVSS v4.0 score:
 8.7 (High)
Attack vector:
 Network
Authentication required:
 None
Any vulnerable MongoDB instance reachable from the internet becomes a potential target, even if authentication is otherwise correctly configured.
Timeline and Active Exploitation
The threat escalated rapidly after disclosure.
December 19, 2025
 – MongoDB publishes the official advisory for CVE-2025-14847
December 26, 2025
 – A public proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit is released, dramatically lowering the barrier to entry
Active exploitation confirmed
 – Multiple security firms report in-the-wild attacks, and the vulnerability is added to 
CISA’s Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog
At this stage, MongoBleed is no longer theoretical or “low priority.”
Technical Root Cause: How the Memory Leak Works
The vulnerability stems from flawed trust assumptions in how MongoDB processes compressed network messages.
Attack flow
Crafted request

The attacker sends a malicious 
OP_COMPRESSED
 message containing a minimal BSON payload.
Buffer size manipulation

The message advertises an 
inflated 
buffer_size
, claiming the uncompressed data is significantly larger than reality.
Oversized allocation

MongoDB allocates memory based on this unverified size.
zlib handling flaw

Due to a bug in decompression logic, the allocated buffer is 
not fully initialized
.
Data leakage

When MongoDB parses the buffer, it processes residual memory from previous operations. Error responses echo fragments of this data back to the attacker.
By repeating requests with varied offsets, attackers can gradually 
reconstruct sensitive in-memory data
 over time.
2005270779953385600
Real-World Impact and Scale of Exposure
MongoDB’s ubiquity across startups, enterprises, and cloud-native applications amplifies the impact.
Metric
Estimated Scale
Internet-facing potentially vulnerable instances
87,000 – 200,000
Cloud environments with at least one vulnerable instance
~42%
Data at risk
Credentials and tokens
 – Database users, session cookies, API keys
PII and regulated data
 – Names, SSNs, medical records, billing details
Application secrets
 – Cloud access keys, encryption material
Because memory disclosure leaves minimal forensic traces, many organizations face a 
presumption of breach
 under GDPR and HIPAA. This mirrors a broader systemic risk seen across modern cloud infrastructure, where tightly coupled services and shared platforms can magnify the blast radius of a single failure—an issue explored in depth in 
The Internet’s Hidden Architecture and Centralization Risk
.
Detecting Exploitation Attempts
Detection relies on identifying abnormal connection behavior in MongoDB logs.
2005096153025839573
Primary indicator: metadata-less connections
Legitimate MongoDB drivers send client metadata immediately after connecting, generating 
Event ID 51800
. Public MongoBleed exploits often omit this step.
A typical attack pattern:
Event ID 22943
 – Connection accepted
Missing Event ID 51800
 – No client metadata logged
Event ID 22944
 – Connection closed shortly after
In confirmed attacks, this pattern appears at extreme velocity. Real incidents have recorded 
over 111,000 short-lived connections per minute from a single IP
.
Open-source detection scripts can automate log scanning for these anomalies and should be incorporated into routine monitoring.
A Legacy of Misconfiguration: The Other MongoDB Security Problem
While CVE-2025-14847 is serious, its impact is magnified by a long-standing issue: 
unrestricted network exposure
.
For years, attackers have not needed exploits at all—they simply connect.
Common misconfiguration pattern
Authentication disabled
, especially in legacy deployments
Public binding
 to 
0.0.0.0
 with no access controls
Internet-wide scanning
 for port 
27017
This same pattern appears repeatedly in other ecosystems as well, from game servers to internal tooling. For a parallel example of how exposed services become attack magnets once they hit the public internet, see 
Minecraft server technology stacks and exposure risks
.
Consequences in the wild
Destructive “Meow” attacks
 – Automated tools connect to open databases and 
wipe all data without ransom demands
Verifications.io breach
 – An exposed MongoDB instance leaked 
809 million records
, contributing to the company’s collapse
In regulated industries, these attacks cause not just data loss but prolonged operational paralysis.
A Unified Defense: Practical MongoDB Security Checklist
Effective MongoDB security requires 
both immediate remediation
 and 
long-term hardening
.
Remediating CVE-2025-14847

Disable 
zlib
 in 
networkMessageCompressors
Use 
snappy
 or 
zstd
, or disable compression entirely
Assume compromise when uncertain
Rotate database credentials
Rotate application secrets and API keys
Invalidate active user sessions
Preventing Misconfiguration Breaches
Enable access control
 with 
security.authorization: enabled
Restrict network binding
 to localhost or private interfaces
Enforce firewall rules
 allowing only trusted hosts to reach port 27017
Encrypt data in transit
 using TLS
Maintain tested backups
—the only reliable recovery from destructive attacks
From Reactive Patching to Proactive Hardening
MongoBleed is ultimately a story of two threats. One demands 
urgent patching
 to neutralize CVE-2025-14847. The other demands a deeper cultural shift—treating configuration, exposure, and defaults as first-class security concerns.
For developers, DevOps engineers, and security teams, the lesson is consistent across ecosystems: 
patch fast, harden permanently, and assume the internet is always watching
.

title: Back to being HBO Max: Warner Bros. Discovery reverting to its old name
excerpt: From Max to HBO Max, marking the 4th rebranding in the last decade

content.text:
Warner Bros. Discovery announced the 
comeback of its former name, HBO Max, earlier on Wednesday. The 
rebranding will officially take effect this summer.\nThe announcement was made during the company’s upfront presentation 
at Madison Square Garden, New York. WBD President and CEO David Zaslav 
confirmed the name will revert to HBO Max again.\nDavid Zaslav, the President and CEO of Warner Bros. Discovery, said 
at the presentation: “The powerful growth we have seen in our global 
streaming service is built around the quality of our programming. Today,
 we are bringing back HBO, the brand that represents the highest quality
 in media, to further accelerate that growth in the years ahead.”\nMore insights on the forthcoming change were put forward by JB 
Perrette, President and CEO of Streaming, and Casey Bloys, Chairman and 
CEO of HBO and Max Content, who remarked, “We will continue to focus on 
what makes us unique – not everything for everyone in a household, but 
something distinct and great for adults and families. It’s really not 
subjective, not even controversial – our programming just hits 
different.” \nElaborating further, Casey Bloys stated, “With the course we are on 
and the strong momentum we are enjoying, we believe HBO Max far better 
represents our current consumer proposition. And it clearly states our 
implicit promise to deliver content that is recognised as unique and, to
 steal a line we always said at HBO, worth paying for.”\nHBO Max was originally launched in 2020 when WarnerMedia was still 
under AT&T. The “Max” suffix was intended to denote the platform’s 
provision of a vast content range which includes reality shows, 
documentaries, children’s programming, films, and premium HBO content.\nAt the time HBO’s audience was considered small and primarily 
U.S.-based, a reason for it being positioned as a sub-brand within a 
larger streaming platform.\nIn 2023, following the divestiture from AT&T and the merger 
between Discovery Communications and WarnerMedia, the service was 
rebranded as "Max." This change also integrated content from Discovery+ 
into the platform.\nNow, two years later, Warner Bros. Discovery is reversing that decision, reviving the old name HBO Max.

children.text:
Warner Bros. Discovery announced the 
comeback of its former name, HBO Max, earlier on Wednesday. The 
rebranding will officially take effect this summer.

The announcement was made during the company’s upfront presentation 
at Madison Square Garden, New York. WBD President and CEO David Zaslav 
confirmed the name will revert to HBO Max again.

David Zaslav, the President and CEO of Warner Bros. Discovery, said 
at the presentation: “The powerful growth we have seen in our global 
streaming service is built around the quality of our programming. Today,
 we are bringing back HBO, the brand that represents the highest quality
 in media, to further accelerate that growth in the years ahead.”

More insights on the forthcoming change were put forward by JB 
Perrette, President and CEO of Streaming, and Casey Bloys, Chairman and 
CEO of HBO and Max Content, who remarked, “We will continue to focus on 
what makes us unique – not everything for everyone in a household, but 
something distinct and great for adults and families. It’s really not 
subjective, not even controversial – our programming just hits 
different.”

Elaborating further, Casey Bloys stated, “With the course we are on 
and the strong momentum we are enjoying, we believe HBO Max far better 
represents our current consumer proposition. And it clearly states our 
implicit promise to deliver content that is recognised as unique and, to
 steal a line we always said at HBO, worth paying for.”

HBO Max was originally launched in 2020 when WarnerMedia was still 
under AT&T. The “Max” suffix was intended to denote the platform’s 
provision of a vast content range which includes reality shows, 
documentaries, children’s programming, films, and premium HBO content.

At the time HBO’s audience was considered small and primarily 
U.S.-based, a reason for it being positioned as a sub-brand within a 
larger streaming platform.

In 2023, following the divestiture from AT&T and the merger 
between Discovery Communications and WarnerMedia, the service was 
rebranded as "Max." This change also integrated content from Discovery+ 
into the platform.
Now, two years later, Warner Bros. Discovery is reversing that decision, reviving the old name HBO Max.

title: Teen pilot Zara Rutherford becomes the youngest woman to fly solo around the world
excerpt: Following a five-month challenge, a teen pilot, Zara Rutherford, has become the youngest woman to fly solo around the world.

content.text:
Following a five-month challenge, a teen pilot, Zara Rutherford, has become the youngest woman to fly solo around the world.
Due to bad weather, Zara Rutherford, 19, arrived two months later than expected in Kortrijk-Wevelgem, Belgium.
She spent a month in Nome, Alaska, and 41 days in Russia on her journey.

The former pupil of St Swithun’s School, Winchester, was welcomed by her family, journalists, and well-wishers upon her return to Belgium.
Four planes from the Belgian Red Devils aerobatic display team accompanied her on her landing.
“It’s just really crazy, I haven’t quite processed it,” she told reporters after landing, wrapped in British and Belgian flags.


She said at a news conference that she was “so glad” she took on the 32,000-mile adventure.
“The hardest part was flying over Siberia – it was extremely cold and if the engine was to stall I’d be hours away from rescue. I’m not sure I would have survived,” she said.
“I’m looking forward to telling people about my experiences and encouraging people to do something crazy with their life.
“If you have the opportunity – go for it.”

The circumnavigation began on August 18 and involved more than 60 stops across five continents.
The British-Belgian flyer’s parents are both pilots. She expressed her desire to encourage other young women to pursue careers in STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math).
Sponsors for the challenge included her former school in Hampshire. Also, Shark, the Slovakian manufacturer of the 
Shark UL aircraft
.
Zara’s old school was one of the first to congratulate her, tweeting that it was “super proud” of her accomplishment.
Shaesta Waiz of the United States was 30 at the time of her attempt in 2017. She was the previous youngest woman to fly solo around the world. The record holder for the youngest male was 18 years old.
Rutherford is not only the youngest woman to complete the challenge. But she is also the first woman to circumnavigate the globe in a microlight. She is also the first Belgian to do so solo.
1485335952910598145


Despite the changes, Ms. Zara Rutherford was confined for a week in Magadan and then three weeks in Ayan.
She also slept in the terminal for two nights after an unannounced layover at Bandar Udara Rhahadi Osman, Indonesia, due to a lack of necessary documents to leave the airport.
Despite the hurdles, and after spending Christmas and New Year’s apart from her family, the teenager appeared to be cheerful and smiling in her Instagram posts.
Flying through wildfire smoke in California was one of her new challenges, she added
Her instruments also failed in New Mexico due to a blocked pitot tube. She was trapped in Singapore during Christmas due to a flat tire.
Then, she was in her sixth-floor hotel room in Veracruz, Mexico, when an earthquake struck.
She said: “Suddenly the building started to sway. I don’t think I’ve ever run faster down the stairs. I was really expecting the most dangerous part of this trip to be in the air.”


Jane Gandee, the headteacher at St Swithun’s School, said students and staff had been following Ms. Zara Rutherford’s voyage “with interest and admiration”.
She said: “As if the actual flying and navigation were not challenging enough, she had to contend with extreme weather and tricky bureaucracy.
“We are immensely proud of the good humor and resilience that she has shown throughout.
“Fifty of our own students have been inspired by Zara to have a go at flying, and I am sure that her example will serve as inspiration for many more young women around the world.”

children.text: Following a five-month challenge, a teen pilot, Zara Rutherford, has become the youngest woman to fly solo around the world.
Due to bad weather, Zara Rutherford, 19, arrived two months later than expected in Kortrijk-Wevelgem, Belgium.
She spent a month in Nome, Alaska, and 41 days in Russia on her journey.
The former pupil of St Swithun’s School, Winchester, was welcomed by her family, journalists, and well-wishers upon her return to Belgium.
Four planes from the Belgian Red Devils aerobatic display team accompanied her on her landing.
“It’s just really crazy, I haven’t quite processed it,” she told reporters after landing, wrapped in British and Belgian flags.
She said at a news conference that she was “so glad” she took on the 32,000-mile adventure.
“The hardest part was flying over Siberia – it was extremely cold and if the engine was to stall I’d be hours away from rescue. I’m not sure I would have survived,” she said.
“I’m looking forward to telling people about my experiences and encouraging people to do something crazy with their life.
“If you have the opportunity – go for it.”
The circumnavigation began on August 18 and involved more than 60 stops across five continents.
The British-Belgian flyer’s parents are both pilots. She expressed her desire to encourage other young women to pursue careers in STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math).
Sponsors for the challenge included her former school in Hampshire. Also, Shark, the Slovakian manufacturer of the
Zara’s old school was one of the first to congratulate her, tweeting that it was “super proud” of her accomplishment.

Shaesta Waiz of the United States was 30 at the time of her attempt in 2017. She was the previous youngest woman to fly solo around the world. The record holder for the youngest male was 18 years old.
Rutherford is not only the youngest woman to complete the challenge. But she is also the first woman to circumnavigate the globe in a microlight. She is also the first Belgian to do so solo.
Despite the changes, Ms. Zara Rutherford was confined for a week in Magadan and then three weeks in Ayan.
She also slept in the terminal for two nights after an unannounced layover at Bandar Udara Rhahadi Osman, Indonesia, due to a lack of necessary documents to leave the airport.
Despite the hurdles, and after spending Christmas and New Year’s apart from her family, the teenager appeared to be cheerful and smiling in her Instagram posts.
Flying through wildfire smoke in California was one of her new challenges, she added
Her instruments also failed in New Mexico due to a blocked pitot tube. She was trapped in Singapore during Christmas due to a flat tire.
Then, she was in her sixth-floor hotel room in Veracruz, Mexico, when an earthquake struck.
She said: “Suddenly the building started to sway. I don’t think I’ve ever run faster down the stairs. I was really expecting the most dangerous part of this trip to be in the air.”
Jane Gandee, the headteacher at St Swithun’s School, said students and staff had been following Ms. Zara Rutherford’s voyage “with interest and admiration”.
She said: “As if the actual flying and navigation were not challenging enough, she had to contend with extreme weather and tricky bureaucracy.
“We are immensely proud of the good humor and resilience that she has shown throughout.
“Fifty of our own students have been inspired by Zara to have a go at flying, and I am sure that her example will serve as inspiration for many more young women around the world.”

title: Apex Legends players disappointed by one odd feature about new Legend’s design
excerpt: After watching the recent Defiance launch trailer, a lot of Apex Legends players were disappointed about the size of Mad Maggie’s arms, arguing that she should have more muscle.

content.text:
After watching the recent Defiance launch trailer, a lot of Apex Legends players were disappointed about the size of Mad Maggie’s arms, arguing that she should have more muscle.
Following months of community speculation, Respawn finally revealed that 
Mad Maggie
 will be the new Legend joining the roster in 
Season 12.

To show how she arrived in the Outlands, the devs put together the short cinematic showing Maggie being pushed out of a plane onto Olympus by the Syndicate.
While the majority of the video was well-received, a small design choice has frustrated a lot of Apex players, and it involves Maggie’s “twig arms”.

Apex players aren’t happy with the size of Maggie’s arms
While the Defiance launch trailer isn’t necessarily representative of Maggie’s model in-game, a lot players were frustrated by the size of her arms in the cinematic.
Taking to 
Twitter
, some members of the community were confused why Respawn felt the need to give Maggie “twig arms”.
Claiming the design choice isn’t accurate and just “doesn’t make sense”, it’s obvious players want the devs to ensure this isn’t the case in-game.
1486733173727772675
According to them, based on Maggie’s actions in the past and her background as a freedom fighter, it would make sense for her to have bigger muscles.
A lot of comparisons have been made with Fuse, and how big he is compared to his old friend in the Defiance trailer.
Keep in mind, the post below has been edited and isn’t showing how Maggie’s arms look in the cinematic.
1486746889722736644
For now, it’s just a case of waiting for February 8 and seeing how big Maggie’s arms are in-game compared to the cinematic.
It’s possible the design choice has only been made for the trailer, but with just under two weeks before Season 12 drops, it’s unlikely Respawn have time to change her model.

title: Record ₹26,632 Crore SIP Inflows: India’s Mutual Fund Milestone in April 2025
excerpt: In April 2025, SIP contributions surged to a historic ₹26,632 crore, driving total mutual fund AUM to a record ₹70 lakh crore. With 46 lakh new SIP registrations and a strategic clean-up of 1.36 crore inactive accounts, India’s mutual fund industry underscores the power of disciplined investing and rising retail participation.

content.text:
India's mutual fund industry achieved a major milestone in April 2025 with Systematic Investment Plan (SIP) contributions hitting an all-time high of 
₹26,632 crore
, according to the 
Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI)
. This marks a 3% rise from March 2025, signaling continued investor confidence and rising participation in mutual fund investments.
📊 Key Performance Metrics
Metric
April 2025
March 2025

18.71

Retail AUM (₹ lakh crore)
40.29
38.84
+3.7%
Source
: Economic Times, AMFI
🏛️ Record SIP Contributions: What It Means
The surge in SIP contributions to a record 
₹26,632 crore
 underscores the increasing popularity of SIPs among retail investors. The disciplined approach offered by SIPs, especially the benefit of 
rupee cost averaging
, continues to resonate with both new and seasoned investors.
Additionally, 
46 lakh new SIPs
 were registered in April—up from 40 lakh in March—indicating strong investor interest and growing financial literacy.
🔍 SIP Account Clean-Up: Focus on Active Investors
AMFI reported the closure of 
1.36 crore inactive SIP accounts
 as part of a clean-up process. This initiative is expected to reduce further from May 2025 onward, aiming to:
Streamline industry operations
Focus on 
engaged, active investors
Improve data quality and operational efficiency
Despite the high 
SIP stoppage ratio of 75.63%
 in FY25, the industry still recorded growth. This suggests that account closures were offset by increased registrations and higher contributions.
SIP Stoppage Metrics
Metric
FY25
FY24
New SIPs Registered (lakh)

📈 Mutual Fund AUM and Retail Participation
The mutual fund industry's 
total AUM reached ₹70 lakh crore
, a significant 6.5% jump from March. This reflects growing investor trust in mutual funds as an effective long-term investment tool.
Retail AUM
 also saw a healthy rise to 
₹40.29 lakh crore
.
Total folios increased to 
23.62 crore
, with 
retail folios
 reaching 
18.71 crore
.
📊 Equity Inflows: Sustained Momentum Amid Market Volatility
Equity mutual fund inflows in April 2025 remained 
stable
 at 
₹24,269 crore
, continuing a 50-month streak of positive equity inflows since March 2021. However, this reflects a 
30% drop
 from the 
₹78,100 crore peak
 seen in June/July 2024.
This cautious approach suggests that while investors remain optimistic, they are reacting to ongoing market fluctuations and adjusting portfolios accordingly.
1921806882005455321
📚 What’s Driving the SIP Boom?
While April 2025 data is still being digested, key factors driving this momentum include:
1. 
Disciplined Investment Approach
SIPs promote regular investing regardless of market timing, which appeals to long-term investors seeking 
stable returns
.
2. 
Rising Financial Literacy
Campaigns by financial institutions and government efforts have made more people aware of the benefits of 
long-term wealth creation
.
3. 
Favorable Economic Indicators
Stable inflation, strong GDP growth, and a robust regulatory framework continue to build investor confidence.
4. 
Clean-Up Impact
The removal of inactive SIPs has helped streamline the sector, creating space for 
more active participation
.
📊 Investor Takeaways
Stay the Course
: Market volatility is natural. SIPs work best when investors stay committed.
Monitor SIP Stoppage
: A high stoppage ratio calls for improved investor education and better product alignment.
Focus on Long-Term Goals
: The steady rise in AUM and contributions reflects the benefits of consistent investing.
🔧 Industry Outlook
India’s mutual fund industry is clearly maturing, backed by retail participation and increasing SIP adoption. With total folios crossing 23 crore and retail investors contributing significantly to AUM, the focus must now shift toward:
Investor retention
Continued education
Simplifying onboarding processes
As AMFI emphasizes, the key is to 
stay invested across market cycles
 to achieve financial goals.


🔍 Historical Context
SIP contributions have seen explosive growth, from around 
₹1.5 lakh crore in FY2015
 to 
over ₹2.4 lakh crore in FY2025
 (up to Nov 2024). The April 2025 record of 
₹26,632 crore
 stands as a testament to the resilience and attractiveness of mutual fund investments in India.
📚 References
AMFI Monthly Mutual Fund Data

Business Today: SIP Contributions Rise, But So Do Cancellations

urtechy.com

title: Mothers Have Desires Too: Why Media Strips Moms of Their Sexuality in 2025
excerpt: This Mother’s Day 2025, explore why society and media erase mothers’ sexuality, from subtle hints in Badhai Ho to bold exceptions like Lust Stories 2. Discover how the male gaze and outdated tropes limit representation—and why it’s time to celebrate moms as whole, desiring humans.

content.text:
The Unseen Side of Motherhood
When you think of a mother, what comes to mind? A nurturing figure, a selfless caregiver, a beacon of hope—perhaps a "human unicorn," as Saraswati Datar puts it. But rarely do we picture her as a woman with desires, especially sexual ones. The moment a woman becomes a mother, society—and the media—often erases her sexuality, boxing her into an idealized, asexual role. Why is that? And what does it cost her?
As we approach Mother’s Day 2025, let’s peel back the layers of this phenomenon. From the subtle hints of intimacy in Badhai Ho to the bold exceptions in Lust Stories 2, this post dives into why mothers are stripped of their sexuality in cinema, OTT platforms, and societal perception—and why it’s time for a change.
The Asexual Mother: A Persistent Trope in Media

https://www.facebook.com/ABC12WJRT/posts/1095140095978968?rdid=0YbhkGyGdWmDOsFm#

In movies and shows, mothers are rarely portrayed as sexual beings. Their identities revolve around their children, and any hint of desire is either absent or treated as a punchline. Consider these examples:
Kirti Kulhari as Anjana
 in Four More Shots Please! is a rare mother shown getting intimate with multiple partners. Yet, her youth, attractiveness, and single status make her an "acceptable" exception.
In Badhai Ho, 
Neena Gupta’s Priyamvada
 gets pregnant in her late forties, but her intimacy with her husband is cloaked in metaphors—thunder, rain, and proximity—rather than shown outright.
Khujli teases kink with 
Jackie Shroff and Neena Gupta
, but ends ambiguously, leaving intimacy to the imagination.
Older mothers or those with post-childbirth bodies are almost never depicted as sexy. When they are, it’s often comical (think the lustful dadi from The Kapil Sharma Show) or taboo, like cougars or unfaithful wives. This desexualization sends a clear message: motherhood and sexuality don’t mix.


Why It’s a Problem:
 By erasing mothers’ sexuality, media reinforces the idea that they exist only for others, not themselves.
The Male Gaze: Who Decides What’s Sexy?
A major reason mothers vanish from sexual narratives is the male gaze—the lens through which much of cinema is crafted. With fewer women filmmakers, men largely dictate who gets to be "sexy." The result? 
Women are objectified, valued for male pleasure rather than their own agency.
Mothers, especially older ones, don’t fit the youthful, unattached ideal, so they’re sidelined.
Historically, mothers in films wept over sewing machines, passed down revenge, or controlled their kids’ lives as nagging stereotypes. Stepmothers (sauteli ma) fared worse, cast as evil fairy-tale villains. Rarely were they individuals with desires beyond their maternal roles.
The Takeaway: 
Until diverse voices—especially women’s—shape storytelling, mothers will remain desexualized on screen.

https://www.instagram.com/p/DJfut68SaQV/


https://www.facebook.com/reel/1459812475388024

Society’s Pedestal: Reverence Over Reality
Why can’t we imagine mothers as sexual? Society puts them on a pedestal, labeling them Devki, Durga, or Lakshmi—divine figures above human flaws like desire. Fathers, meanwhile, remain fallible, congratulated for the bare minimum. This double standard:
Idealizes mothers as pure and selfless, stripping them of personal needs.
Makes it taboo to see them as regular people with sexual agency.
Saraswati Datar captures it perfectly: “What I miss most is the permission to be wrong, mediocre, selfish, unhappy and imperfect.” Motherhood demands sacrifice, but it shouldn’t demand the erasure of a woman’s humanity—including her sexuality.
Real-Life Impact: 
This reverence isolates mothers, pressuring them to suppress their desires to fit an impossible mold.
Breaking the Mold: Films That Dare to Differ
Thankfully, some stories challenge the norm, offering hope for change:


Amruta Subhash as Seema in Lust Stories 2 
has sex with her husband in a cramped, realistic setting—a rare portrayal of intimacy amid parenthood’s chaos.
In The Sky is Pink,
 Priyanka Chopra and Farhan Akhtar
 play parents of teens with an active sex life, defying the "asexual parent" trope.
Married Woman features Riddhi Dogra as a mother exploring love with another woman, showcasing desire’s complexity.
Kalyug (Shyam Benegal) shows 
Reema Lagoo and Kulbhushan Kharbanda
 enjoying intimacy post-parenthood.
These exceptions matter. They prove mothers can be multidimensional—nurturing yet sexual, selfless yet human.
Why It’s Progress:
 These portrayals normalize mothers’ sexuality, chipping away at outdated stereotypes.
The Call for Change: Realism Over Reverence
Motherhood is transformative, exhausting, and fulfilling—but it doesn’t erase a woman’s identity.
 This Mother’s Day 2025
, we need media to reflect that truth with:
Diverse Portrayals:
 Show mothers of all ages, body types, and backgrounds as sexual beings.
Authentic Stories:
 Let mothers express desire without shame or comedy.
Balanced Perspective:
 Replace reverence with realism, acknowledging mothers’ full humanity.
This shift benefits everyone. It frees mothers from stifling ideals and teaches society to see them as whole people.
How You Can Help: Watch and share films like The Sky is Pink or Lust Stories 2. Demand better representation from creators.
Celebrating Mothers, Desires and All
This Mother’s Day, let’s honor mothers not just for their sacrifices but for their complexity. Society and media have long stripped them of their sexuality, but exceptions like Anjana, Seema, and Priyamvada’s subtle rebellion show change is possible. “Maa ke paas bhi desire hain”—mothers have desires too. It’s time we let them be seen, heard, and celebrated as the full, flawed, beautiful humans they are.
What do you think? How should media portray mothers’ sexuality? Share your thoughts in the comments below!

title: Shamita Shetty reveals what she told Colors team when offered Bigg Boss 15: ‘What is the point? I know I will not win’
excerpt: Shamita Shetty addressed allegations of Tejasswi Prakash being a ‘biased winner’ and revealed her conversation with the Colors team when she was offered Bigg Boss 15.

content.text:
Shamita Shetty revealed her conversation with the Colors team when she was offered Bigg Boss 15. She said that she told them ‘point-blank’ that even though the audience would take her ahead in the show, she knew that she would not win.
Bigg Boss 15 was won by Tejasswi Prakash, with Shamita coming in fourth. Pratik Sehajpal and Karan Kundrra were the first and second runners-up, respectively.
1488204217651105792
In an interview with Bollywood Bubble, Shamita was asked if Tejasswi was a biased winner, to which she said, “What can I say? See, I have shared a very good relationship with Colors, I have done some of the biggest reality shows with them. When I was offered this one also, I told them point-blank, ‘What is the point of doing it? I know I am not going to win.’ I get into any reality show already with this thought in my mind, knowing that the audience may take me to the final five or three, but I never win. I don’t really know how it works. At the end of the day, it’s wrong for me to comment because I don’t know the truth. I can only say that I was very disappointed when Pratik did not win. All of us were.”

Shamita previously appeared in Bigg Boss 3 but walked out of the show midway to attend her sister Shilpa Shetty’s wedding with Raj Kundra. Apart from Bigg Boss, she participated in two other reality shows that aired on Colors--Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 8 and Khatron Ke Khiladi 9.
On being told about many Bigg Boss 15 viewers calling her the ‘real winner’, Shamita said, “I would much rather not win and have silence in the studio or have people questioning my win. I would much rather have the love that I am receiving today and respect. For me, that is my victory. I have had people like me for the human being I am. This is not Shamita Shetty, the actor. This is not about a performance. I have spent half a year in this reality show and people have seen who I am as a person, as a human being, and I think they have loved that. For me, that is a big achievement, that is what I take back with me.”

See, I have shared a very good relationship with Colors, I have done some of the biggest reality shows with them. When I was offered this one also, I told them point-blank, ‘What is the point of doing it? I know I am not going to win.’ I get into any reality show already with this thought in my mind, knowing that the audience may take me to the final five or three, but I never win. I don’t really know how it works. At the end of the day, it’s wrong for me to comment because I don’t know the truth. I can only say that I was very disappointed when Pratik did not win. All of us were.”

Shamita previously appeared in Bigg Boss 3 but walked out of the show midway to attend her sister Shilpa Shetty’s wedding with Raj Kundra. Apart from Bigg Boss, she participated in two other reality shows that aired on Colors--Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 8 and Khatron Ke Khiladi 9.

On being told about many Bigg Boss 15 viewers calling her the ‘real winner’, Shamita said, “I would much rather not win and have silence in the studio or have people questioning my win. I would much rather have the love that I am receiving today and respect. For me, that is my victory. I have had people like me for the human being I am. This is not Shamita Shetty, the actor. This is not about a performance. I have spent half a year in this reality show and people have seen who I am as a person, as a human being, and I think they have loved that. For me, that is a big achievement, that is what I take back with me.”

title: Mastering Machine Learning: A Deep Dive into Linear Regression's Building Blocks
excerpt: Learn how to interpret coefficients and intercepts in both simple and multiple linear regression models. Master the fundamentals of predictive modeling and gain insights into the decision-making process of machine learning algorithms.

content.text:
Introduction:
Linear regression is a fundamental algorithm in machine learning, empowering us to predict numerical values based on input features. While the concept may seem straightforward, the underlying mechanisms of coefficients and intercepts are critical to grasping how these predictions are made. In this in-depth guide, we'll break down these components, explore their roles in both simple and multiple linear regression models, and illustrate their significance with real-world examples.



What is Linear Regression?
Linear regression models the relationship between input features (independent variables) and a target variable (dependent variable).  It assumes a linear relationship, meaning that as the input features change, the target variable changes proportionally. This relationship is captured in a linear equation:
y = mx + b


y:
  The predicted value (e.g., house price)
x:
  The input feature (e.g., house size)
m:
  The coefficient (slope), quantifying the change in y for each unit increase in x
b:
  The intercept, the value of y when x is zero

Unraveling Coefficients: The Engine of Predictions
Coefficients are the driving force behind linear regression. They act as multipliers, dictating the impact of each input feature on the predicted value. A positive coefficient indicates a positive correlation (as the feature increases, so does the prediction), while a negative coefficient implies a negative correlation.

Example: Predicting House Prices Based on Size
Imagine we want to predict house prices based on their size. Our model might determine:
m = 100
 This means each additional square foot adds $100 to the predicted price.
So, our linear equation becomes:
Price = 100 * Size + b


Understanding the Intercept: The Starting Point
The intercept (b) represents the baseline prediction when all input features are zero. In many real-world scenarios, this value lacks practical significance, as it's often impossible for all features to be zero (e.g., a house can't have zero square feet). However, the intercept is mathematically crucial to complete the linear equation and correctly position the regression line.

Beyond Size: Multiple Linear Regression with Multiple Features
In most cases, the value we want to predict isn't solely determined by one feature.  Multiple linear regression allows us to incorporate multiple input features, each with its own coefficient, for more accurate predictions.
y = b₀ + b₁x₁ + b₂x₂ + ... + bₙxₙ


y:
 Predicted value
x₁, x₂, ..., xₙ:
  Input features
b₀:
 Intercept
b₁, b₂, ..., bₙ:
 Coefficients for each feature

Example: A Multi-Faceted House Price Prediction
Let's enhance our model to include house size (x₁), number of bedrooms (x₂), and age (x₃):
After training, our model might find:
b₀ = 50,000
b₁ = 100
b₂ = 10,000
 (Each additional bedroom adds $10,000)
b₃ = -500
 (Price decreases by $500 for each year older)

Our equation becomes:
Price = 50,000 + (100 * Size) + (10,000 * Bedrooms) - (500 * Age)

For a 1,500 sq ft house with 3 bedrooms and 10 years old, the predicted price is:
50,000 + (100 * 1500) + (10,000 * 3) - (500 * 10) = $225,000

Visualizing Linear Regression:

Key Takeaways:
Coefficients
  quantify the impact of each input feature on the predicted value.
Intercepts
  represent the base value when all input features are zero.
Simple linear regression
  models the relationship between one input feature and the target variable.
Multiple linear regression
  incorporates multiple features for more accurate predictions.
Conclusion:
By understanding coefficients and intercepts, you gain a deeper appreciation for the inner workings of linear regression, a powerful tool for prediction and analysis in machine learning. Whether you're predicting house prices, stock values, or other numerical outcomes, linear regression provides a versatile framework for uncovering patterns and making informed forecasts.
External Links:

IBM | Linear Regression

title: Lock Upp: Munawar Faruqui’s Entry In Kangana Ranaut’s Show Results In Meme-Mela, Ashneer Grover’s “Bhai Kya Kar Raha Hai Tu” Will Make You LOL!
excerpt: Lock Upp are TV actress Nisha Rawal, comedian Munawar and Poonam Pandey.

content.text:
Comedian Munawar Faruqui is all set to appear in Kangana Ranaut’s controversial reality show Lock Upp. Backed by Ekta Kapoor, the web show, which will premiere on ALT Balaji and MX player, will see 16 controversial contestants. The first 3 confirmed contestants of Lock Upp are TV actress Nisha Rawal, comedian Munawar, and Poonam Pandey.
Ever since the promo of the comedian dropped on the web, netizens are having a field day. It’s been a meme fest owing to the comedian’s past ‘collab’ with Kangana Ranaut.


A user said, “Munawwar & Kangana are both on the same show. Bhakts were last heard crowdfunding to buy a bigger JCB for Sanjay Raut.” Another even posted Ashneer Grover’s snap from Shark Tank India and asked him, “Bhai tu kya kar raha hai.”
Another said, “Oooo godddd!!! Its actually happening … One should NEVER SAY NEVER btw . Lmao after watching samaya’s stories … This guy ! . But it’s actually true . If Munawar × kangana Then emiway × krshna not a big deal #KKundrraSquad #TeJran Watch this u will rofl!”
One user even lauded Ekta Kapoor for bringing them together for the TRP. The Tweet read, “Such a smart move by Ekta Kapoor to bring #MunawarFaruqui and 
Kangana Ranaut
 together for the TRP for the new show Lock Upp.”
1496048608680222724
1496054729067343873
1496046480997629953
1496057137746829319
1496062510205751296
Meanwhile, in his latest interview, Munawar said his stay in the show with jailer Kangana Ranaut is going to be a ‘give and take’ situation. He told Indian Express, “If someone believes in ideologies, they would also believe that we live in a democratic country. We all have the freedom of speech and to put across our beliefs. If one expects to be heard and their opinions respected, they too would have to do the same. It’s going to be a give and take situation.”

Munawar
, who’s often being mired in controversies, believes that there’s nothing wrong in being a controversial person. Further adding he said, ““Firstly, I don’t think there’s anything wrong in being controversial. It only means that people did not hear your side of the story, or maybe you were taken out of context. I never wanted to be a part of controversies. I never went and told the media my statement to cause some bawaal (commotion),”

title: 'Proud of his monumental contribution': India pays tributes on Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose birth anniversary
excerpt: The Indian President Ram Nath Kovind and other top politicians have paid rich tributes to Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose on his 125th birth anniversary.

content.text:
The Indian President Ram Nath Kovind and other top politicians have paid rich tributes to Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose on his 125th birth anniversary. 
On January 23, India celebrates the birth anniversary of Bose, who is a prominent Indian freedom fighter. The Indian government last year announced that his birth anniversary will be celebrated as 'Parakram Diwas' every year. 


Also, the day will mark the start of Republic Day celebrations instead of a day later. PM Modi will unveil a hologram statue of Bose at the India Gate on Sunday.
Bose was born to advocate Janakinath Bose in Odisha's Cuttack in 1897. He played a crucial role in India's freedom struggle against the oppressive British colonial rule. He is also known for establishing the Azad Hind Fauj. 


To mark the occasion, President Kovind said, "India gratefully pays homage to Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose on his 125th birth anniversary. The daring steps that he took to fulfil his fierce commitment to the idea of a free India -- Azad Hind -- make him a national icon. His ideals and sacrifice will forever inspire every Indian." 
Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "I bow to Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose on his Jayanti. Every Indian is proud of his monumental contribution to our nation."

1485069031296344067

1485068875020795904

Remembering Netaji, Vice President M. Venkaiah Naidu tweeted, "My respectful tributes to the great nationalist, legendary freedom fighter and visionary leader, Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose on his birth anniversary today. We commemorate this day as #ParakramDivas to honour Netaji's indomitable courage and selfless service to the nation."
"The nation is indebted to the iconic leader for his monumental role in the freedom struggle," Naidu said.
Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said, "Greetings to you on 'Parakram Diwas'. I bow to the epitome of courage and valour, Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose on this occasion. He went to great lengths while fighting for the freedom of his motherland. His contribution in India's freedom struggle continues to inspire us."
